column2: True horses no longer, Dark Magic corrupts the finest Elven steeds and turns them into black-flanked killers.
Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Naggaroth, tempted from their damp, warm caves to bear the Druchii to battle.
The corrupted Dark Pegasi fly south from the Chaos Wastes to Naggaroth's Iron Mountains to make their nests.
Secretly nurtured by Malekith, Black Dragons are enchanted with Dark Magic that corrupts and enhances.
It is hard to remember the face of a Shadow Sorceress — harder still to track her steps. Those that have tried have returned confused, moon-struck, or occasionally dead.
A Fire sorceress can wield flame as other warriors can wield swords and bows.
Even the most sane and balanced person exposed long enough to the malign energy of True Dhar will become psychotic, absolutely self-obsessed, and completely uncaring of other living creatures.
Should a Battle Wizard need a mount, then his station would ensure he receives a warhorse of good breed.
Should a Battle Wizard need a mount, then his station would ensure he receives a warhorse of good breed.
Battle Wizards are rarely armoured for it interferes with their casting, yet a steed can and should be barded to add a level of protection.
Battle Wizards are rarely armoured for it interferes with their casting, yet a steed can and should be barded to add a level of protection.
Imperial pegasi are found in Grey Mountains where Bretonnian and Empire hunters fight over capturing the foals.
Imperial pegasi are found in Grey Mountains where Bretonnian and Empire hunters fight over capturing the foals.
The bond between rider and steed goes beyond friendship or family; they act as one.
Its forehead adorned with a spiral horn, this noble mount carries the Spellsinger where their magical gifts are needed most.
Fly on your wings, like an eagle. Touch the sun. Track the foe, ambush, and defeat.
Each strike of a Shadowdancer's blade is made with uncanny precision, capable of severing a head or piercing a heart with one deceptively elegant stroke.
The Shadowdancers rain blow after blow upon their opponent, moving with such speed that the eye cannot follow each distinct cut and thrust.
With agile grace the Shadowdancers evade the clumsy attacks of their enemies, becoming almost impossible to strike.
Forgoing armour, the Shadowdancers decorate themselves with swirling designs and dye their hair in bright colours.
They, and only they, know all the paths through Athel Loren — indeed, it is said that they tread the paths of the Dreaming Wood as surely as they do the mortal world.
Should a Battle Wizard need a mount, then his station would ensure he receives a warhorse of good breed.
Should a Battle Wizard need a mount, then his station would ensure he receives a warhorse of good breed.
Imperial pegasi are found in Grey Mountains where Bretonnian and Empire hunters fight over capturing the foals.
Imperial pegasi are found in Grey Mountains where Bretonnian and Empire hunters fight over capturing the foals.
A griffon is a majestic beast - part lion, part eagle, and extremely deadly and terrible to behold in battle, for the foe at least.
A weapon from the College of Light, vaporising their enemies by channelling the Wind of Hysh.
With the need for professional soldiers always on the rise, each Imperial soldier is regularly trained, equipped, and maintained at the expense of the Imperial government.
Three things make the Empire great; faith, steel and gunpowder.
Even heavily armoured Chaos Warriors can be torn to shreds by a single artillery volley, such weapons needs to be handled by the most talented engineers.
I am eager to discuss knightly virtue further with Sir Guy or any other Bretonnian who cares to call mine into question. My lance and I will shortly put the matter to rest.

Does our most holy father reward those who take the easy road? Does he traffic in temptation? Of course not! Sigmar rewards hard work, resolve in the face of temptation, and, above all, courage when confronting mortal danger.
The Luminark of Hysh is a large and complex arcane Battle Altar created by the Wizards of the Light Order to be used as a potent magical Warmachine.

The Lord Magisters of the Orders of Magic are powerful individuals. It is very rare for a Magister to reach this level of mastery, and those that do are rightly treated with the fear and respect given to the highest nobles.
Only the most dire of threats to the Empire can get a Wizard Lord to leave the comfort of his laboratory in the Colleges of Magic to face the difficulties and endless frustrations of the field.
This stinky hog is as grumpy and fierce as its brutal rider.
Wyverns are highly-prized mounts for the most powerful of Orc Warlords.
If there's something that a Savage Orc can't smash to bits, then it probably can't be smashed.
If there's something that a Savage Orc can't smash to bits, then it probably can't be smashed.
It's true. Red Onez do go fasta!
He snores and eats all our gobbos, but dat big lug is handy in a fight!
Arrer boyz use crude and primal bows, yet surprisingly they are very effective at killing, friend and foe
Bring another bucket, I ain't blue enough!
You can't keep a good 'danca' down, especially when those drums start bangin'!
This stinky hog is as grumpy and fierce as its brutal rider.
Wyverns are highly-prized mounts for the most powerful of Orc Warlords.
Tunnel bosses are Greenskins who are good at shoutin’ and hollerin’ at mobs when underground, where space and sight is an issue.
It's true. Red Onez do go fasta!
Arrer boyz use crude and primal bows, yet surprisingly they are very effective at killing, friend and foe
This stinky hog is as grumpy and fierce as its brutal rider.
Wyverns are highly-prized mounts for the most powerful of Orc Warlords.
A Experienced Slayer is often joined on his journeys by a swarm of younger brethren from the Slayer cult.
Slayers seeks nothing more in life than an honorable and glorious death that shall expunge the shame that has pushed him upon this path, and to be remembered in the saga's of his people for all time.
While Dwarfs are generally not the most nimble inhabitants of the Old World, they can move surprisingly fast when not slowed by heavy armour.
Dark, corrupting, evil forces have no place here!
No servant of the Midnight Aristocracy dares stand against the veteran Slayer.
Urks, like all slimy fungus, must be wiped from the boot whenever trodden upon.
Such high-minded ways and pure ideals count for nothing when you’re wormfood.
As a Slayer continues to carve a massive toll of beast upon his axe, they often take the names of the beast they slay. Such names includes becoming a Trollslayer, or a Giantslayer.
Whether by their sheer martial skills, toughness or determination, these Dwarfs, though unsuccesful in their quest, have inadvertently been molded into a magnificent warriors.
Daemon Slayer, a warrior who has managed to survive the encounter with one of the most ferocious creatures to ever live, slaying it and surviving to tell the tale.

Some Slayers, despite their best efforts to find and fight the most formidable of foes, still fail at their task of dying in battle. By dint of constant fighting, these rare Slayers become ever more scar-riddled and dangerous.
Skaven are a disease, a cancer on this world… You are a plague and we are the cure…
The weight of every single insult, grievance, umbrage and ill-feeling, channelled into a single, crushing swing of the axe.
Who wants to live forever? This angst-ridden fighter surely doesn't, but now he must seek out and battle ever more ferocious enemies.
Gors and other Beastmen follow in Doombull's wake, consumed by the desire to wolf down the hot flesh of their enemies.

When called to war, the Doombull's reach into the piles of weapons and armour heaped in offering before the herdstones, equipping themselves with the largest and most formidable weapons they can find.
A Doombull, with axes in hand, can hold its own against dozens of enemies with vicious, brutal fury.
To the Minotaurs, a battlefield is a place of maddening excess. The scent of gore in their flaring nostrils drives them wild and they bellow their hunger for all to hear.

When Morrslieb is full in the sky, the Doombulls roar out a bellowing call that resounds around the forest for many miles, attracting yet more Minotaurs and invoking the bloodgreed that runs through all of their kind.
Consumed by bloodgreed, the Minotaurs lay waste to their prey in an orgy of slaughter, smashing through barricades and buildings alike to get at the still-living weaklings that cower within.
Stamp and trample! Gore and crush!
Though no master of strategy or battle doctrine, a Doombull is capable of leadership, of a sort. It is he that bellows the raw will of the Dark Ones.
Even when not feasting, the Beastmen taste blood on their lips, smell it on their fur, and want for more.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.
A ranger should give no reprieve to the foe. Arrows must fall like a deluge, as deadly as lightning.
Armour as hard as the ancient bark of the forest, it repels blows that would rend others asunder.
No hide nor armour can stand against the piercing fury of the Dryad's savage limbs.
The Lord charges their troops to fight for Athel Loren, for their very souls are tethered to its fate.
The bond between rider and steed goes beyond friendship or family; they act as one.
Its forehead adorned with a spiral horn, this noble mount carries the highsinger where their magical gifts are needed most.
Fly on your wings, like an eagle. Touch the sun. Track the foe, ambush, and defeat.
The bond between rider and steed goes beyond friendship or family; they act as one.
Its forehead adorned with a spiral horn, this noble mount carries the darksinger where their magical gifts are needed most.
Fly on your wings, like an eagle. Touch the sun. Track the foe, ambush, and defeat.

Thus far, none have succumbed to the same madness that claimed Ariel all those centuries ago, but it is impossible to say what the future will bring. In the meantime, Athel Loren cannot afford to reject such a potent resource.
Despite the Mage Queen’s best efforts, every generation of Wood Elves after the Season of Retribution has yielded a handful of magi attuned to the dangerous path of Dark Magic.
When Asrai dreams of a great undertaking, it is Lileath whispering to them as they sleep.

To avoid potential danger while on dangerous journeys, the mages focus their powers into spells of protection around them and their companions, moving them beyond the physical realm and mundane hazards.
The Vampire can sense the remains of long-dead warriors and awaken them to holster his unholy ranks.
Even the lowliest Necrarch follows the long and difficult path of the Necromancer.
The Necrarch can focus his power into a different plane to foresee the future and change the present.
Who can match the magical ability of a creature so ancient that its teacher might have been the Great Necromancer himself!
Long must one study to gain knowledge of the netherworld, but time is no worry to an undying scholar.
And I'll lead you all in the dance, said he - the relentless dance of the tireless Undead hordes.
Come to my side, my Undead servants. Now, you are bound, irrevocably, to my will forever!
The only thing the Necrarchs could take from their land was their necromantic lore. These secrets are found in the cursed scrolls hidden in the lairs of the oldest Lords of the Necrarch family.
Some knowledge is so dangerous that it is revealed only to those deemed worthy of the responsibility.
This one spends much time attempting to divine the future, peering through the mists of time and recording their visions.
I am not here to inspire, I am here to kill - come let us draw blades together!
Through his words and deeds, this one has made a name for himself within noble kingdoms of the Undead.
Fortunately, there are some who really apply themselves to the problems of the world. Just as well, otherwise we'd be… Oh wait...
You don't want to be on the wrong side of this one's ire - it's explosive to say the least!
The most impressive Nightmares are those reared on fresh blood. Such noble monstrosities are worthy mounts.
To me, my winged steed of bone and flesh; let us fly and remake the world together!
It is to the Plain of Bones that a Vampire Lord travels to claim a Zombie Dragon as their mount.
These morbid carriages are omens of disaster and death. They are horrific, unholy things, neither wholly real nor immaterial.

During their mortal lives, these unearthly knights used weapons bearing enchantments of destruction. Though corrupted by the patina of the ages, these tools of slaughter are no less potent than when the wielder was a man of flesh and blood.

The arcane bloodline of the Necrarchs were the first to bind Hexwraiths into their armies - some say they learnt the art of their summoning from the stolen Book of Arkhan, others that the legendary Melkhior was the first to master their control.
These eerie, silent sentinels stand constant vigil on the crumbling battlements and at the iron-bound gates, never resting, eternally ready to defend their Vampire masters.
This Vampire has a strong kinship with Ghouls, using them as its eyes and ears in the wider world.

In their never ending study for their own thirst for blood, this Necrarch has experimented with himself by turning into a mobile nexus of Dark Magic, replacing the need for blood with a need for warpstone, but needless to say this wasn't a great success he was hoping for.
Far removed from the petty squabbles of other races, Necrarchs seek to master a variety of natural philosophies, depending on their inclinations.
This Lord can hear the thoughts of mortals for leagues around, and plan accordingly.
Once slain in battle, the foe belongs to the Undead Lord, and will rise again, eager to serve.
An army of ancient warriors stand ready to fulfill the commands of their Vampire general. Rank after rank of armed Skeletons rise from their graves to answer the Vampire's bidding.
By shifting its physical form into a vaporous state, the Vampire becomes invulnerable to mortal weapons and is almost impossible to destroy.
Who knows what terrors lurk in the dark places of the world, biding their time until the moment to strike has come?
Sometimes, in the uncertain light of the forest, a hunter can see a beautiful pale girl, but in the blink of an eye she disappears. If he is wise, he should realise that he is now the prey.
How swift and sure is the tread of these beautiful and arrogant maidens of Undeath!
The will of this Vampire is so strong, that the vampire can overcome even the terrible power of the sun.

These deceptive creatures look so inoffensive and vulnerable that naïve enemies lower their defenses. That is when they strike with all their supernatural strength, ripping apart armour and bodies with their seemingly innocent hands.
Behind every great man is a great woman. And behind those great women is me.
This Sylvanian proverb could not be more true, especially for the swift and nimble Lahmian Vampires.
How can a mortal resist the allure of a creature who has preyed on warm blooded males since the dawn of time? Who can refuse to become her willing slave?

Is it possible to dart aside and avoid a cannon ball? Is it possible to grab an arrow in fight with one's hand? It certainly is for these Vampires. The sword-strikes of even the most skilful men are but clumsy and childlike before the preternatural speed of the Vampire.
The most impressive Nightmares are those reared on fresh blood. Such noble monstrosities are worthy mounts.
To me, my winged steed of bone and flesh; let us fly and remake the world together!
A true lord or lady of undeath refuses to churn through the mud of a battlefield like a common peasant or be content with the dubious dignity of sitting astride a grave-beast.
Nocturnal spectres hiding from the light, addicted to your blood.
Evil takes flight; blotting out the moon on blackened wings, calling us to the dance…
The darkness within us all, given free rein to lust and gorge eternally.
The body of a Vampire looks human, but is capable of reactions so fast that even the quickest swordsman would look clumsy in comparison.
The Lahmians are secret string-pullers of the world, invisibly exerting untellable control over history.
The Lahmians immortal plots are difficult for short-lived humans to see, and some that were set in motion in antiquity have yet to come to fruition.
Sometimes, in the uncertain light of the forest, a hunter can see a beautiful pale girl, but in the blink of an eye she disappears. If he is wise, he should realise that he is now the prey.
By shifting its physical form into a vaporous state, the Vampire becomes invulnerable to mortal weapons and is almost impossible to destroy.
Using a combination of great strength and amazing speed, it is easy for the Vampire to create a gap in his opponent's guard.
A knight and his horse share a very strong bond – so strong that sometimes it can continue even after death.

Such is the Vampire's martial prowess that he is able to strike at the precise moment when it will cause the most carnage. Further, a true knight will never abandon his armour and sometimes the steel skin becomes part of his own body.
The Vampire has trained for centuries in the use of his favourite weapons, acquiring a skill that is rarely matched, even by the best of mortals.
Many mortal champions regret their rash pride after the valiant challenge they issued is accepted by a creature whose eyes are the eyes of death itself.
Trained by the best swordsmen of different periods and cultures, the Vampire has become a deadly warrior capable of slaying the most monstrous of foes.
The Undead Lord has followed the warrior's path to its ultimate conclusion, in a dark mockery of a Knight's vow.
These eerie, silent sentinels stand constant vigil on the crumbling battlements and at the iron-bound gates, never resting, eternally ready to defend their Vampire masters.

During their mortal lives, these unearthly knights used weapons bearing enchantments of destruction. Though corrupted by the patina of the ages, these tools of slaughter are no less potent than when the wielder was a man of flesh and blood.
The most impressive Nightmares are those reared on fresh blood. Such noble monstrosities are worthy mounts.
After death the Vampire's muscles grow far greater than they ever could have been in his mortal life. The Vampire becomes a beast of pure muscular power.
So powerful is the unholy presence of the Vampire that mere mortals are forced to flee in dread and terror.
Driven by bloodlust beyond mortal comparison, the Vampire fights with an intensity that turns aside the most skilled parry or stoutest shield.

There are armour-clad Vampire Knights in the world, pursuing their martial glories with deathless vigour. This Vampire has followed the path of the warrior to its ultimate conclusion, taking up arms in dark mockery of a knightly vow.
This Vampire has a strong kinship with Bats, and vampires battle cry is answered by the baying of countless bats bolstering its forces.
This Vampire has a strong kinship with Wolves, and vampires battle cry is answered by the baying of countless wolves bolstering its forces.
This stinking mortal hold will fall! Bring them ruin!
The most impressive Nightmares are those reared on fresh blood. Such noble monstrosities are worthy mounts.
To me, my winged steed of bone and flesh; let us fly and remake the world together!
A true lord or lady of undeath refuses to churn through the mud of a battlefield like a common peasant or be content with the dubious dignity of sitting astride a grave-beast.
As Dragon Ogres grow older, they grow larger, continuing to increase in size as the centuries pass by.
It is thought that only death in battle can destroy a Dragon Ogre, for otherwise they will survive until the end of time.
The Dark Gods influence extends to the ferocity of their servants' attacks, increasing their power and reach manyfold.
Violence bordering on absolute delirium; 'berserk' doesn't even come close.
War and glory before the Gods are the determining elements in every decision made; there is nothing else worth living - or dying - for.
The freezing darkness and stunning violence of the far north bring no small solace to those who have lost everything and wish to forget.
Mutations awarded by the Chaos Gods to their followers may look horrific to southerners, but such gifts are prized.
As lightning bolts pour from the skies, the Dragon Ogres answer the call to war.
The Dark Gods reward any pragmatic technological advances devised to wage war in their names by greatly improving their capabilities and performance.
Once awakened, the Dragon Ogres battle to ascend the highest peaks and receive the lightning blasts that will invigorate them and extend their lives.
The line between heavy mutation and spawndom is a fine one, and most hordes accept these bloated, writhing creatures into their ranks.
Powerful beasts and monsters are enhanced if under the command of the Dark Gods.
To the Northmen, there is no greater honour than to fight and perish under the gaze of the Gods.
Like all Shaggoths, This one is invigorated by the touch of lightning, and the roar of the storm.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption - as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.
This Shaggoth hates all humans, even more than other Dragon Ogres and wishes to exterminate them all from this world.
The intense cold cuts into the flesh, burning the foe's extremities until they drop off altogether!
Those who bear the Mark of Khorne are consumed with a violent rage and the constant need to shed the blood of their foes.
The Mark of Nurgle often manifests as a cluster of warts and buboes. Its bearers are accompanied by a miasma of pestilence.
The same enchanted mist that obscures Fimirs dwellings can also be conjured to confound and horrify would-be attackers on the battlefield.

Fimir dwellings are seldom seen by outsiders, for they are wreathed in thick mist, a miasma which is magically generated by the Fimir to shield their fortresses from prying eyes, and themselves from the harsh glare of the sun.
The Fimir are amphibious humanoid monsters that haunt bogs, fens and desolate moorlands throughout the northern and western Old World.
Those who do not bend the knee to the Gods of the North soon find all they hold dear obliterated before them.
Fimir are loathsome, one-eyed reptilian creatures, infamously degenerate and malign and possessed of dark powers.
Powerful beasts and monsters are enhanced if under the command of the Dark Gods.
To the creatures of Chaos, there is no greater honour than to fight and perish under the gaze of the Gods.
The frenzied creatures, whose packs are formed by kinship ties of blood and slaughter, care not what they kill in their bloodlust and bear no loyalty to any master, save the Dark Gods themselves.
More fool they who go to war and quest with minds unfocused, for they risk the Eagle's desolate, underhand deceptions.
As the undisputed master of magic, the Eagle uses complex sorcery to influence its followers and draw opponents into his multifarious, interwoven schemes.
The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.
Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.
Manticores are huge leonine beasts with the wings of a giant bat and tails the drip with poison. They are the fiercest of all Chaotic mounts.
This vicious beast carries a warshrine aloft, carrying blasphemous icons and unholy relics to battle in sight of the Chaos Gods.
The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.
Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.
Manticores are huge leonine beasts with the wings of a giant bat and tails the drip with poison. They are the fiercest of all Chaotic mounts.
This vicious beast carries a warshrine aloft, carrying blasphemous icons and unholy relics to battle in sight of the Chaos Gods.
The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.
Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.
Manticores are huge leonine beasts with the wings of a giant bat and tails the drip with poison. They are the fiercest of all Chaotic mounts.
This vicious beast carries a warshrine aloft, carrying blasphemous icons and unholy relics to battle in sight of the Chaos Gods.
Unstable and miscreated, the Crow's strength spreads and grows like the most successful of diseases, consuming all before consuming itself and beginning again.
With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption - as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.
Men are little more than plague-ridden dogs - put them out of their misery!
Some beings just don't know when to put the bottle down.
This one has something of the compost heap about them…
To cause another's suffering, to delight in their pain, to extend their agony according to your whim. That is power.
Armour is just a formality when you're as hard as nails and as tough as old boots.
Every fibre of their being is charged and ready for action - wherever, whenever.
